Early stage crypto is extremely crowded. There are 3 consequences:

(1) It’s a great time to be an early stage founder-not investor

(3) Creates a large dichotomy between early stage private and later stage liquid valuations

Bitcoin, more than anything, is a bet *against something*. It's a bet against the status quo, inflationary and repressive monetary regimes. And it's a bet on the secular decline in power of the USD.

Buying Bitcoin is a put on the USD.

1013796407675891712.text: So to get to this hyper stage, there will have to be more ways to earn and interact with Bitcoin.

1013795492604637191.text: Many people don't want to spend, as there is a belief it will go up in value. As more people involved we will reduce the volatility and exponential growth rates it has. By then, though, the value will have greatly accrued and it will become a more viable means of spending.

1013794212935077889.text: As Bitcoin can get more ingrained into our society, where it be faucets, inclusion in applications, etc, we will see price of it go up, as well as people utilizing more for everyday transactions.

1013793792569303044.text: To truly reach this phase, we need more low-risk ways of purchasing and engaging with Bitcoin. Currently, the best way to engage directly is through purchasing through exchanges.
